knimeNode.name: LSSMiner
knimeNode.shortDescription: The Longest Shared Sequence Miner looks for the longest subsequence of the test data inside the training sequences.

fullDescription.intro: The Longest Shared Sequence Miner looks for the longest subsequence of the test data inside the training sequences. As soon as a sequence longer than (bestFound - MaxVariation) is found, it it added to the output table. Therefore it it guaranteed that the longest shared sequence is included, but there may be also some former found sequences contained.
fullDescription.option: Choose the Column (of the test table) which contains the test sequences.
Choose the Column (of the training table) which contains the training sequences.
Choose how big the gap may be between two shared characters of the test sequence.
Choose how big the gap may be between two shared characters of the training sequence.
Choose how many shared characters have to be found at least.
New found sequences must not necessarily be longer than the currently best found sequence but may differ by the specified amount of characters.
Append the length of the found shared sequences.
Append the found shared sequences (this may take 1/5 additional time).

ports.outPort: The longest shared sequences (depending on the parameters) plus some former found sequences.
